sections.title: Image Processing with Tensors
sections.content: Learn how to process and manipulate images using PyTorch tensors

training_simulations.title: Loading Images as Tensors
training_simulations.mission: Create a basic pipeline to load and convert images to tensors
training_simulations.content:
import torchvision.transforms as transforms
from PIL import Image

transform = transforms.ToTensor()
img = Image.open('image.jpg')
img_tensor = transform(img)
training_simulations.solution_sequence:
transform = transforms.ToTensor()
img = Image.open('image.jpg')
img_tensor = transform(img)

# Verify shape and values
print(f'Tensor shape: {img_tensor.shape}')
print(f'Value range: [{img_tensor.min():.2f}, {img_tensor.max():.2f}]')
training_simulations.solution_explanation: This converts image data into a normalized tensor format (range [0,1]) with shape [C, H, W]

hints.text: ToTensor() automatically scales pixel values from [0, 255] to [0, 1]
hints.example:
# Before: pixel values [0, 255]
# After: tensor values [0, 1]

hints.text: The output tensor shape will be [Channels, Height, Width]

training_simulations.title: RGB to Grayscale Conversion
training_simulations.mission: Convert RGB images to grayscale tensors
training_simulations.content:
# Create a transformation pipeline for grayscale conversion
# Output should be a single-channel tensor

transform = transforms.Compose([
    # Add conversion steps here
])
training_simulations.solution_sequence:
transform = transforms.Compose([
    transforms.Grayscale(1),
    transforms.ToTensor()
])

# Verify output
img_gray = transform(img)
print(f'Grayscale tensor shape: {img_gray.shape}')
training_simulations.solution_explanation: Using Grayscale(1) ensures a single-channel output before converting to tensor

hints.text: The grayscale conversion must happen before tensor transformation

common_errors.solution: Check tensor shapes using tensor.shape before operations
Reduce batch size or clear cache using torch.cuda.empty_cache()
Use retain_grad() or create tensor with requires_grad=True

best_practices: Use del to remove unnecessary tensors
Move tensors to CPU when not in active use
Clear CUDA cache between large operations
Consider using gradient checkpointing for large models
